title: â€˜Chlorine chickenâ€™ could be added to UK menu after Brexit deal
text:
â€” Brian Groom (@GroomB) February 1, 2017 
In the US, chemicals are frequently used to reduce bacterial contamination along the food processing chain, while poultry farms in the UK have to adhere to a number of hygiene regulations set out by the EU. 
Many directives are imposed at farm level in a bid to reduce or eliminate bacteria, although there are also a number of checks in place along the processing chain. This new Nando's option sounds rubbish. https://t.co/Kv053f7tSI â€” James Chalmers (@ProfChalmers) February 1, 2017 Mmm, chlorine chicken sounds delicious. https://t.co/qF5t7V9MBd â€” Kai MacMahon (@kaimac) February 1, 2017 Chlorine chicken... I thought my local takeaway was bad https://t.co/6I9MI8g2se â€” AK Nawaz (@nawazcrimehack) February 1, 2017 Interesting US is flagging up meat and chicken products as trade priorities. Not sure growth hormones and chlorine are my fave ingredients. â€” ruth wishart (@ruth_wishart) January 24, 2017 
â€œWeâ€™re asking for our chance to compete,â€ Farm Bureau spokesman William Rodger told BuzzFeed . â€œIf Britons are afraid of these techniques, they wonâ€™t buy food produced with them. Thatâ€™s their right, regardless if itâ€™s irrational.â€ 
According to a 2014 blog post from the European Consumer Organisation (BEUC), however, â€œthere is no added-value or justification to throwing our approach overboard and paving the way for chemically treated poultry to enter our market.â€ What is this chicken dipped in chlorine we've been deprived of? Coq au piscine? I've always liked the smell of pool on skin. â€” Metin HÃ¼seyin (@MetinHuseyin) February 1, 2017 Yum, chlorine-coated chicken. One of those delicious delicacies the dreadful EU currently prevents us from eating... https://t.co/a7DjxIicpP â€” Caroline Stocks (@Caroline_Stocks) February 1, 2017 Hang on, do I need an opinion on chlorinated chicken now? â€” Duncan Weldon (@DuncanWeldon) February 1, 2017 @SarahLudford A lot of American chicken meat is soaked in chlorine as well as injected with antibiotics while alive. No thank you. â€” Robert W. PierceğŸ‡ªğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡§ (@Rob71350) January 19, 2017 
This isnâ€™t the first time for the issue of chlorine washed chicken to be raised, as it has consistently been noted as a concern by those opposed to the Transatlantic Trade and Investment Partnership (TTIP) agreement between the EU and US. EU - as strong equal partner - continued to refuse chlorine chicken or hormone beef in TTIP. UK alone has far less to bargain with #r4today â€” Jenni Dunsmore (@yennimimi) January 24, 2017 @swilliamsmp @kazjohnson yum yum chlorine soaked chicken + sugar and fat pumped full of drugs & pesticides. And we will be desperate to sign â€” Les Campbell (@lesvcampbell) January 21, 2017 @JolyonMaugham we need red lines. No changes to our regulations for goods. E.g. No GMO corn, chlorine chicken or over-powered hoovers. â€” Chris Gould (@Chr1sGould) January 23, 2017 
What do you think, would you eat chlorine chicken? Let us know in the poll below.
